html:
Updates

** Shares of buy now, pay later (BNPL) firm AFRM.O pare premarket gains, but still up nearly 11% at $147.81

** Co said after market close on Wednesday it had expanded its deal with Amazon

** Under new deal, all eligible purchases of $50 and more on Amazon can be split into monthly payments for U.S. shoppers; feature was earlier available only to select customers (Full Story)

** RBC raises price target to $175 from $130, while Credit Suisse hikes PT to $150 from $105

** "AFRM is the BNPL of choice for large scale enterprise platforms," say RBC analysts

** AFRM is now the only third-party BNPL option for the e-commerce giant, except credit cards - co

** Co also reported Q1 revenue of $269.4 mln, beating est of $248.2 mln

** Seven of 13 brokerages rate the stock "buy" or higher, five "hold" and one "sell"

** Shares debuted on Nasdaq in January, opening at $90.90 each


(Reporting by Niket Nishant in Bengaluru)

(( Niket.Nishant@thomsonreuters.com ;))
